page.title: 18Flying In Abbotsley
page.content: On Tuesday the 11th of June 1985 our class went to Abbotsley.Our group went to Abbotsley's parachute club.Our group leader Mr Harding pilots a plane for the club.We asked him a number of questions.One of the answers that he gave suprised us, that the plane he flies took 4O gallons of petrol every two flying hours.He showed us what all the knobs do and we were allowed to sit in the pilot's seat and put the head phones on. Then we took a walk down the runway.Mr Harding told us that most parachutists come from different parts of Britain some times from abroad.About two years ago there was a tragic accident when for some reason or other a man's parachute didn't open properly and he died on impact.
